image.altText: Daniel Duggan

props.synopsis: Facing up to 65 years in prison, Australian "top gun" pilot, Daniel Duggan, says he's an innocent man in a high-stakes game between the US and China. So, is he?

title.children: For 62 days, this former US marine had no idea why he was locked in a NSW prison

image.altText: Joe and Jill Biden wave as they enter a stage draped with US flags.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has attempted to reassure supporters after his damaging debate performance, conceding he doesn't speak as well as he used to, but insisting he can still competently serve.

title.children: 'I'm not a young man, to state the obvious': Biden vows to 'get back up' after damaging debate

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Canberra man Steven Howarth wiped tears from his eyes as, after less than a day of deliberations, a jury found him not guilty of raping a woman he met at a New Year's Eve party in 2023.

title.children: Canberra man acquitted of raping woman at New Year's Eve party in 2023

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Julian Assange's faces in a composite image.

props.synopsis: Some frame Julian Assange as a free press warrior and others a reckless hacker but as Anthony Albanese backed quiet diplomacy to free him — the fact it's highly unusual wield political influence over the legal systems of our democratic allies seems to have been lost in the haze.

title.children: Everyone smells blood in the water around the government. Framing the issues has become more important than ever

image.altText: A man in glasses wearing a tie.

props.synopsis: An emotional Anthony Albanese has revealed that an accused teenage terrorist's manifesto allegedly included direct threats on his family.

title.children: Anthony Albanese says he was threatened in accused teen terrorist's manifesto

image.altText: A half empty beer glass sits on a wooden table top beneath lights

props.synopsis: The craft beer scene's biggest festival of the year became an inadvertent staging point for the many intersecting issues facing the industry. Brewers tried to put on a brave face but admitted "vibes were down."

title.children: Craft breweries are hanging on, but will beer lovers stick with them in a cost of living crunch?

image.altText: Nigel Farage stands holding a beer in a pub wearing a blue suit with a red waistcoat smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: One of Brexit's biggest supporters is likely to be voted in to parliament for the first time, despite a series of controversies in the lead-up to election day.

title.children: A campaign volunteer suggested shooting migrants but Nigel Farage looks set for parliament anyway

image.altText: A bald man sitting at a ABC branded microphone with an on air sign lit up in the background.

props.synopsis: CSIRO CEO Dr Doug Hilton is urging politicians not to undermine scientists in the energy debate, after finding himself in the political firing line.

title.children: CSIRO chief urges politicians not to undermine scientists in energy debate

image.altText: A composite image of two women, one holding her face in her hands, and another wearing a crown of flowers.

props.synopsis: An alleged murder involving two well-known writers and former friends has shocked the Pacific island nation of Samoa. Police are still piecing together what happened.

title.children: 'I was possessed by the devil': Two close friends, an alleged murder and a nation 'reeling in disbelief'

image.altText: An Australia post parcel from a compounding pharmacy on a table.

props.synopsis: The end of the financial year is a great time for shoppers looking to bag a bargain. But scammers also tend to take advantage of the period. Here's what to look out for.

title.children: Planning to shop the end of financial year sales? Watch out for this scam

image.altText: Henri Pelissier stands in a crowd

props.synopsis: In a small cafe in a nondescript French village during the 1924 Tour de France, a journalist fell upon the biggest scoop in cycling, when three Tour riders revealed what they were carrying in their bags to get them through the most daunting of races.

title.children: 'We ride on dynamite': A century on from the Tour de France's first doping scandal

props.synopsis: Satellite images show much of the Lebanese village of Aita al-Shaab in ruins after months of Israeli air strikes, offering a glimpse of the scale of damage in one of Hezbollah's main bastions in south Lebanon.

title.children: 'Unfit for living': Satellite images show Israeli bombs have flattened parts of South Lebanon village

image.altText: A wide mountainous area with an inset of a smiling young man

props.synopsis: Amid glaring neon signs, cheap alcohol and booming music, friends of missing 19-year-old Jay Slater saw him for the last time before he vanished.

title.children: A missing teen told a friend he was 'lost in the mountains' of a remote Spanish island. Then his phone went dead

image.altText: A white woman wearing sunglasses holds her polo shirt which has a soccer ball logo, she's standing in front of a soccer pitch

props.synopsis: The Matildas have redefined women’s football in Australia, and it has led to Australia’s blind and Deaf women’s football teams flourishing like never before. But a lack of funding means that breaking new ground has proven to be anything but straightforward.

title.children: How the Matildas effect has inspired Australia’s women's blind and Deaf footballers

props.synopsis: Scientists used to think birds were split into two groups: those that learn or imitate sounds, and those that can't. But a tiny wren from Aotearoa New Zealand bridges the two.

title.children: NZ's smallest bird may be a 'missing link' in the evolution of birdsong

image.altText: A destroyed battery

props.synopsis: Isolated incidents of EV batteries landing in the tip will become more common as the first wave of electric vehicle batteries reaches its end-of-life, the sector says, posing more risk of a "catastrophic" landfill fire.

title.children: Waste sector fears 'catastrophic' electric vehicle battery fires, as first wave of EV batteries reach end-of-life

image.altText: snow covered fields in new south wales oberon

props.synopsis: Polar air from Antarctica is surging towards south-east Australia, bringing gusty winds, showers and low-level snow. While midwinter cold outbreaks are typical, the subsequent weather is nothing short of bizarre.

title.children: Strongest cold front of 2024 to bring weekend snow, followed by potential record-breaking 'blocking high'

image.altText: Young Female Welder Working In Factory Wearing Protective Safety Gear.

props.synopsis: There's more bill pain underway for households, but it's businesses that will bear the brunt of the latest gas crisis rippling through Australia's south-eastern states in the dead of winter.

title.children: Businesses 'on stand-by to switch off' in fallout from gas crisis gripping Australia's east

image.altText: The members of Seventeen pose for a photo wearing preppy outfits.

props.synopsis: A confusingly named Korean pop band you might never even have heard of had the biggest-selling album in the world last year and is about to play at Glastonbury.

title.children: K-pop group Seventeen is rivalling with Taylor Swift and making history in the UK. Here's why they're so popular

image.altText: Glass is badly shattered in the window and it's hard to see through it to the outside.

props.synopsis: The ACT government will implement a developer licensing scheme after laws are passed by the Legislative Assembly. It's hoped it will better protect buyers.

title.children: Soon after Shane bought his newly built apartment, he started noticing issues

image.altText: A sign outside a tertiary education campus

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission finds former CIT chief executive Leanne Cover guilty of serious corrupt conduct.

title.children: Former CIT CEO guilty of 'serious corrupt conduct', ACT Integrity Commission finds

image.altText: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris laughing and clasping hands

props.synopsis: Joe Biden's poor debate performance has resulted in cries from within his party to replace him as a candidate in the United States presidential election.

title.children: A 'disaster' debate performance stirs Democratic panic about Biden's candidacy

image.altText: an aerial shot of a housing estate

props.synopsis: ABS data reveals a big lift in household wealth driven by Australia's white-hot property market.

title.children: Millions of property owners just made $25,000 without lifting a finger

image.altText: Kai Lohmann celebrates while looking towards the crowd

props.synopsis: Brisbane overruns Melbourne in the last quarter to post a spirited five-point win, but the Demons are adamant their best form is ahead of them despite their seventh defeat of the season.

title.children: ‘We feel like we’re building’: Demons find positives in heartbreaking loss to Lions

image.altText: Matt Burton celebrates

props.synopsis: Matt Burton kicks a golden point field goal to ice the game for the Bulldogs to move fifth on the ladder and continue the Sharks' mid-season slump.

title.children: Bulldogs win in golden point thriller thanks to 'goldfish' Matt Burton after Nicho Hynes misses sitter for Sharks

image.altText: Nine News entertainment network logo

props.synopsis: In announcing 200 job losses on Friday, Nine Entertainment has joined other commercial media outlets in feeling the chill from a cooling economy as more corporate budgets slash their marketing spend.

title.children: A chill wind is blowing through the media and it could be a warning sign for everyone

image.altText: A man walking with children in a field of grass.

props.synopsis: These charts show how Australian households are beginning to change as people decide to delay having children, or opt out completely.

title.children: Single dads are projected to grow by almost 70 per cent over the next 20 years

image.altText: An image composite showing Donald Trump speaking and Joe Biden responding.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and former president Donald Trump conclude their debate in Atlanta, Georgia — and pundits are united in their view that it was a bad night for the president. Take a look back at how the debate unfolded.

title.children: Biden stumbles as Trump deflects in 'game-changing' presidential debate — as it happened

image.altText: A still from a video shows Greg Lynn sitting at a desk in a police station.

props.synopsis: Newly released police tapes reveal how Greg Lynn explained the deaths of Carol Clay and Russell Hill to officers during the interview in which he was charged with their murders.

title.children: Watch how Greg Lynn explained campers' deaths to police after his arrest during murder investigation

image.altText: A police sign surrounded by trees, with the Aboriginal flag behind it

props.synopsis: WA's Corruption and Crime Commission declares police efforts to investigate its own officers were "inadequate" after the "unlawful and unjust" arrest of an Indigenous teen.

title.children: CCC delivers scathing findings against WA Police after forceful arrest of 14-year-old Indigenous girl

image.altText: Group of men stand arm-in-arm smiling atop a mountain in Kyrgyzstan. Clear day with mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: It's a long, steep and winding road for Australia's Olympic wrestlers as they train in the remote mountains of Kyrgyzstan with eyes on gold in Paris.

title.children: Meet the Aussie wrestlers training for the Olympics in rural Kyrgyzstan

image.altText: A woman smiles

props.synopsis: A 42-year-old man is charged with murder after police found the body of a woman at a home in Russell Lea.

title.children: Man charged with murdering housemate at home in Sydney's inner west

image.altText: Rubbish on the floor of a home.

props.synopsis: A baby who died in squalid conditions on a fold-out couch at a home in regional SA would have been removed from the property days earlier if child protection authorities had responded to an early warning, a coronial inquest concludes.

title.children: Death of 11-week-old in squalor followed 'significant missed opportunity' for intervention

image.altText: The watercolour painting featuring Harry Potter in front of the Hogwarts Express at Kings Cross Station

props.synopsis: Thomas Taylor was just 23 years old when he landed his first professional commission to illustrate the first Harry Potter book cover. It's now sold at auction for $2.8 million.

title.children: One of the most famous book covers in history just sold for nearly $3 million

image.altText: A man wearing cold weather gear standing amongst a town covered in snow

props.synopsis: A Perth man is released on strict bail conditions after appearing in court accused of starting up "evil twin" wi-fi networks, to get the personal details of users at multiple locations, including airports across Australia.

title.children: Perth man allegedly set up fake wi-fi networks to steal people's personal data at airports
